intro: Strobilanthes diandra var. diandra, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame-of-the-forest," is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka and southern India. It is characterized by its striking orange-red inflorescences, which resemble flames and bloom during the rainy season. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers. It thrives in tropical climates and prefers well-drained soil and partial shade. Despite its beauty, it is relatively rare in cultivation and is often found in specific forest habitats.
